entries.femaleVariant: What's goin' on, Night City! Today I've got a special show for the media-heads... and the dedicated voyeur! The Dynalar TX-43 Opti-Zoom!
Now, I've had my eye on these sweet optics for a while, 'cause Dynalar's last model went waaaay above my expectations... But, will it do the same this time?
Here's the scoop – the TX-43 gives you fifteen times higher magnification with just a tiny dip in resolution.
But probably the most important thing about the TX-43's that it doesn't have any neural side effects. This time 'round the dizziness and migraines only occur when you're in motion.
It's also worth mentioning that the TX-43 Opti-Zoom's got twenty different iris patterns with dope names like Zombie, Jaguar, Chameleon, and my favorite – Snowglobe.
Downsides? Dynalar's policy means you'll have to give 'em access to any pics taken with the Opti-Zoom for marketing or research purposes. But that's just standard procedure.
Here's my verdict – the TX-43's got excellent quality-to-price value, so this is a solid five out of five. Tune in next time, and keep on chippin' in!
Really useful for anyone looking to buy the premium version, which comes with a built-in braindance implant.
